intro: Esenbeckia leucophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf esenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence, giving it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
